props.summary:
Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, and principles** for the **"Modern Application Development I"** exam, along with **key equations** (where applicable) and **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- --- ## **Core Topics & Concepts Summary** ### **1. Flask Framework** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Routing & Views**: - `@app.route('/path')` decorators define URL endpoints. - Trailing slashes (`/about` vs `/about/`) trigger automatic redirects in Flask. - Example: ```python @app.route('/home') def home(): return "Home" ``` - **Request Methods**: - `GET`: Data in URL (visible, cached, bookmarked). **Avoid for sensitive data** (e.g., passwords). - `POST`: Data in request body (hidden, secure). - **Template Rendering**: - Jinja2 syntax: `{{ variable }}`, `{% block content %}`. - **Common Pitfalls**: - Missing `{% block content %}` in child templates (e.g., `home.html` extending `base.html`). - Custom template folders: `app = Flask(__name__, template_folder='custom_templates')`. - **Error Handling**: - `abort(404)` for missing resources. - `try-except` blocks for invalid inputs (e.g., non-integer `marks` in `/score`). - **Flask-RESTful**: - Resource classes with `get`, `post`, `put`, `delete` methods. - Route registration: `api.add_resource(MyResource, '/path', '/path/')`. - **Method Signature Mismatch**: Ensure route parameters match method signatures (e.g., `post(self, course_code, student_id)`). #### **Key Equations/Logic:** - **Grade Calculation** (from `/score` endpoint): ```python if marks >= 90: grade = "A" elif marks >= 75: grade = "B" elif marks >= 60: grade = "C" else: grade = "F" ``` --- ### **2. SQLAlchemy & Databases** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Relationships**: - `db.relationship('Model', backref='field', cascade="all, delete")`: - `cascade="all, delete"`: Deleting a parent (e.g., `Author`) deletes children (e.g., `Book`). - **Lazy Loading**: - `lazy='dynamic'`: Returns a query object (not immediate data) for filtering. - **CRUD Operations**: - Query: `Student.query.filter_by(id=2).first()`. - Update: `student.name = "Riya"; db.session.add(student)`. - Delete: Cascading deletes via `cascade` (no explicit code needed). #### **Key SQLAlchemy Snippets:** ```python # One-to-Many Relationship class Author(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) books = db.relationship('Book', backref='author', cascade="all, delete") class Book(db.Model): id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True) author_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('author.id')) ``` --- ### **3. Git & Version Control** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Branching/Merging**: - Merge `feature1` and `feature2` into `main`: ```bash git checkout main git merge feature1 git merge feature2 ``` - **Conflict Resolution**: - Always `git pull` before `git push` to avoid conflicts. - **Error Scenario**: Pushing without pulling after a teammate’s commit → **rejected push**. --- ### **4. HTML/CSS/JavaScript** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Block vs. Inline Elements**: - Block: `
`, `

`, `

` (new line). - Inline: ``, ``, `` (same line). - **CSS Styling**: - Bold text: `element.style.fontWeight = "bold"` (not `style="bold"`). - Border: `border: 1px solid black` (not `border-colour`). - **DOM Manipulation**: - `document.getElementById("id").style.property = "value"`. #### **Example:** ```html ``` --- ### **5. Testing (Pytest & Unit Tests)** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Pytest Markers**: - `@pytest.mark.unit`, `@pytest.mark.integration`. - Run specific tests: `pytest -m "unit"` or `pytest -m "not slow"`. - **Assertions**: - `assert result == expected, "message"`. - **Fixtures**: Simulate isolated environments (e.g., test databases). - **Output Analysis**: - `1 passed, 3 deselected`: Only tests matching the marker ran. #### **Example Test Output:** ```bash # Command: pytest -m "not slow" ============================= test session starts ============================= collected 4 items / 3 deselected / 1 selected math_tests.py::test_multiply_positive PASSED [100%] ============================= 1 passed, 3 deselected in 0.02s ============================= ``` --- ### **6. HTTP & REST APIs** #### **Key Concepts:** - **HTTP Methods**: - `GET`: Retrieve data (idempotent). - `POST`: Create data (non-idempotent). - `PUT`: Full update (idempotent). - `DELETE`: Remove data (idempotent). - **Status Codes**: - `200 OK`: Success. - `201 Created`: Resource created. - `400 Bad Request`: Invalid input (e.g., missing `age`). - `404 Not Found`: Resource missing. - `422 Unprocessable Entity`: Semantic errors (e.g., short query). - **Flask-RESTful Routes**: - `api.add_resource(Resource, '/path', '/path/')`. #### **Example API Response:** ```python # POST /students without 'age' return {"message": "Age is required"}, 400 # Bad Request ``` --- ### **7. Performance & Networking** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Bandwidth Calculation**: - **Time to Download** = File Size / Speed. - Example: 10 MB file at 5 Mbps (0.625 MB/s) → **16 seconds**. ```math \text{Time (s)} = \frac{\text{File Size (MB)}}{\text{Speed (MB/s)}} = \frac{10}{0.625} = 16 ``` --- ### **8. Security & UX Principles** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Nielsen’s Heuristics**: - **Visibility of System Status**: Show errors (e.g., "Wrong credentials"). - **Error Prevention**: Validate inputs (e.g., `marks` must be integer). - **Sensitive Data**: - **Never use `GET`** for passwords (visible in URL/history). - Use `POST` with HTTPS for security. --- ### **9. Logging & Debugging** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Python Logging Levels**: - `DEBUG` (10) → `INFO` (20) → `WARNING` (30) → `ERROR` (40) → `CRITICAL` (50). - **Configuration**: ```python logging.basicConfig(level=logging.WARNING, format='%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s') ``` - **Example Output**: ```bash 2024-07-29 10:15:32,125 - ERROR - Negative number provided: -5 ``` --- ### **10. Jinja2 & String Templates** #### **Key Concepts:** - **Hybrid Rendering**: - Combine `string.Template` and `Jinja2`: ```python str_template = Template("Hello ${user}") # Step 1: String substitution jinja_template = JinjaTemplate(str_template.substitute(data)) # Step 2: Jinja rendering ``` - **Output**: - Input: `{"user": "Bob"}` - Output: `Hello Bob!`. --- --- ## **Mermaid Knowledge Graphs** ### **1. Flask Ecosystem** ```mermaid graph TD A[Flask Core] --> B[Routing] A --> C[Templating] A --> D[Request Handling] B --> B1[@app.route] B --> B2[GET/POST Methods] C --> C1[Jinja2 Syntax] C --> C2[Template Inheritance] D --> D1[Request Args] D --> D2[Form Data] ``` ### **2. SQLAlchemy Relationships** ```mermaid graph TD A[Author] -->|one-to-many| B[Book] A -->|cascade='all, delete'| C[Delete Author → Delete Books] B -->|foreign_key| A B -->|backref| A ``` ### **3. Git Workflow** ```mermaid graph LR A[Local Changes] -->|git add| B[Staging] B -->|git commit| C[Local Repository] C -->|git push| D[Remote Repository] D -->|git pull| C ``` ### **4. HTTP Methods & Status Codes** ```mermaid graph TD A[HTTP Methods] --> B[GET] A --> C[POST] A --> D[PUT] A --> E[DELETE] B -->|Success| F[200 OK] C -->|Created| G[201 Created] C -->|Bad Input| H[400 Bad Request] D -->|Updated| F E -->|Deleted| I[204 No Content] ``` ### **5. Testing Pyramid** ```mermaid graph TD A[Testing] --> B[Unit Tests] A --> C[Integration Tests] A --> D[System Tests] A --> E[Acceptance Tests] B --> B1[pytest -m unit] C --> C1[Flask Client] D --> D1[Full App Environment] ``` ### **6. HTML Element Types** ```mermaid graph TD A[HTML Elements] --> B[Block] A --> C[Inline] B --> B1[div] B --> B2[p] B --> B3[h1] C --> C1[span] C --> C2[a] C --> C3[strong] ``` --- --- ## **Key Equations Summary** | **Topic** | **Equation/Logic** | |-------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | Bandwidth Calculation | `Time (s) = File Size (MB) / Speed (MB/s)` | | Grade Calculation | `if marks >= 90: "A" elif marks >= 75: "B" elif marks >= 60: "C" else: "F"` | | SQLAlchemy Cascade | `cascade="all, delete"` → Parent delete triggers child delete. | | Flask Route Parameters | `@app.route('/path/')` → `type` can be `int`, `string`, etc. | | Pytest Markers | `pytest -m "unit"` → Runs tests with `@pytest.mark.unit`. | | Git Merge Order | `git checkout main; git merge feature1; git merge feature2` | --- ## **Exam Tips** 1. **Flask**: - Remember trailing slashes (`/about` vs `/about/`). - `lazy='dynamic'` returns a query object, not data. - Template blocks (`{% block content %}`) must be filled in child templates. 2. **SQLAlchemy**: - `cascade="all, delete"` is critical for automatic deletions. - `backref` creates reverse references (e.g., `book.author`). 3. **Git**: - Always `pull` before `push` to avoid conflicts. - Merge order: Checkout target branch first (`git checkout main`). 4. **Testing**: - Pytest markers (`@pytest.mark.unit`) filter tests. - `deselected` in output means tests didn’t match the marker. 5. **HTTP**: - `400` = Bad Request (missing/invalid data). - `422` = Unprocessable Entity (semantic errors, e.g., short query). 6. **JavaScript/CSS**: - `fontWeight = "bold"` (not `style="bold"`). - `border: 1px solid black` (not `border-colour`). 7. **Performance**: - Convert units consistently (e.g., 5 Mbps = 0.625 MB/s). 8. **Security**: - Never expose sensitive data in URLs (`GET`). - Use `POST` for passwords/credentials.
